subject: Re: [junit] Question about changing the name of tests
msgSnippet: ... Did you read the overriding runTest() version of the recipe? I think it s either a separate recipe, an alternative implementation, or a complete solution
messageBody:
Mike Foley wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I want to change the name of my individual tests in the test report
> and/or in the test results xml file.
>
> I am using the JUnit Recipes Parameterized Test Case Design Pattern,
> and all my tests are then named "doTest". I'd like individual test
> case names, and I am not sure how to do this. I see the method setName
> ()....but if I change it to something other than "doTest" my tests
> fail.

Did you read the "overriding runTest()" version of the recipe? I think
it's either a separate recipe, an alternative implementation, or a
complete solution in the appendix. I can't remember which and I'm too
lazy to look it up.

If you don't override runTest(), then the test runner demands that the
test name be the name of the test method you intend to invoke, so
override runTest().

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
